author: yorickdowne
content:
Ethereum 2.0 is already live. R&D progressed and what was previously phases became features: Merge, sharding, light client. Shards became data shards (+DAS), not execution shards; merge turned out to be far simpler than thought, with Vitalik's "minimum merge" proposal. PoS is years past schedule - going for the merge next is simply what's, well, next. There are more features to be had for the EVM, but there will *always* be more features for the EVM, and if you always wait for "just one more thing, one more feature fork", you're never going to merge. For some value of never.
Disclaimer: My interpretation of things by reading this Discord and skimming ACD calls; *not* an authoritative opinion in any way.

author: yorickdowne
content:
Just looking at the docs and press releases it's really weird, <@!636289909359116290> . Stuff like "Ethereum wants to shard PoW", those are words, but I don't know what they mean. They seem nonsense. Granted that may not have been the ETG team directly, or the outlet got it wrong. And stuff like "we hate 1559, but also tx fees will be near zero". Okay -- more detail please. If tx fees are already near zero, what's bad about 1559? What makes tx fees be near zero? More gas in the block? But that blows up state. How would this then be "the people's blockchain"? Or some other method? But then which? Or just "we are going to be so low-volume gas won't be an issue, and we plan to address it in these ways going forward?" Would all be good detail.

 Forking a chain is easy. Maintaining it, and doing the R&D to keep it moving forward, that's hard.
